newsitem.title: USA: Fed seen refraining from open market operations.
newsitem.headline: Fed seen refraining from open market operations.

text.p: The Federal Reserve Bank of New York is expected to refrain from open market operations on Tuesday, Fed watchers said.
"We expect the Fed to stay out today," said Dana Saporta, economist at Stone and McCarthy Research Associates Inc.
Analysts at consulting firm MMS International Inc. also see no Fed intervention on Tuesday.
At 1030 EDT/1430 GMT, federal funds were trading at 5-3/16 percent, below the central bank's 5-1/4 percent target.
